intro: Ardisia crenata f. xanthocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited glorybower, is a variant of the evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. One of its most distinctive features is its bright yellow berries, which contrast sharply with its foliage. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
